author: robocopsgonemad
content: question on the t8n tests in retesteth: did we change the key in the env.json from `beaconRoot` to `parentBeaconBlockRoot` and if so where is the place upstream that standardizes on it? it's an easy fix, I just want to make sure it's not gonna break other env.jsons

author: marioevz
content: I think this one is my fault, I remember changing it to match geth, but it also made sense to me back then because this is the name used in the EIP (it uses `parent_beacon_block_root`)

author: dimitry8570
content: Yes it was changed around 2 months ago to match geth t8n, pyspec and eip

author: robocopsgonemad
content: interesting, where should I be looking for an upstream commit that made that change, i didn't see it in retesteth

author: danceratopz
content:
It might only be visible in the fixtures, not in retesteth itself. Here's thee commit that effects test fixtures generated by execution-spec-tests:
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/commit/9191b956f23f0974b96bcfbaee42787d7e4c2b07

author: robocopsgonemad
content: ok, then I'm not gonna feel bad about not having any test coverage on this

author: danceratopz
content:
Hopefully, these days, we'd add that to the breaking changes in our fixture release notes here:
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases
